name: 42 Macro
title: Will President Trump Listen To The Doves in His Cabinet, Or Will They Listen To Him?
text:
Synopsis
President Trump is expected to maintain an aggressive trade policy in his second term, with tariffs playing a central role and potential significant currency market implications for 2025.

Key Insights
- Trump rejected a leaked Washington Post article suggesting a narrower tariff implementation than his campaign promises
- Tariffs are anticipated to be a key policy tool in Trump's second term
- Tariffs may be used as a budget stabilization mechanism to support tax cut extensions
- Expect China to likely devalue its currency to offset new tariffs
- Potential sympathy devaluations in other major currencies are anticipated
- These currency dynamics could contribute to a global refinancing "air pocket" in 2025
- The currency and trade policy shifts could impact global balance sheet capacity
